The claim was made by a six: term senator during a campaign stop in Iowa on July 4, stating that "This guy is brain-dead."
The definition of brain death as: irreversible unconsciousness with complete loss of brain function" was referenced from the Encyclopedia of Death and Dying.
The lack of evidence was highlighted: suggesting that there were no medical tests conducted by Biden to support the diagnosis. It was mentioned that acceptance of the claim would require proof such as a cerebral blood flow study or evidence of Biden examining Bush for an oculocephalic reflex.
Testimony from individuals who disagree: acknowledging that the president exhibits spontaneous respiration and responds to stimuli. This contradicts the claim of brain death.
